title: Toxicity in Games
body:
I'm just curious about how riot intends to strengthen its efforts to combat toxicity in games. Currently the report system is showing a fairly clear level of failure to the degree that most intentional feeders I encounter doubt it even works. Not only this but people who submit reports have no way of knowing the level to which this is helping. I have reported many such toxic players yet have no way of knowing if this report has done anything.

Just my two cents on the darkest part of this community.

replies.body: harden up and that will solve ur problems

Riot has been actually doing some improvements (i know some of this because i'm doing a research about toxicity in games for an essay), but about what you said about the report system, i never know when or if the player i reported, has a warning or if it's banned. Ask a request to Riot i would like for them to try and better those things. 

Also sorry about the bad and not helping comment but it's the first time i ever discussed something in a board {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Not sure about you guys i get frequent report cards from riot in the league client saying the people i've reported haven't improved and have been punished. Pretty much 1 every fortnight
The only toxicity i care about are people throwing the game. I mute all as a matter of course these days because toxicity is a given.
